author: acolytec3
content: Following on my takeaway from the last implementers call, I've reworked my websockets implementation of discv5 transport somewhat and built out the simple proxy/UDP relay that <@!364458974906548225> mentioned so now browser based discv5 clients can interact with the UDP based clients via the relay and it's transparent to the broader network

author: acolytec3
content: It's only a proof of concept at this point but it allows browser based nodes to complete the discv5 handshake and exchange packets successfully as long as the proxy stays up.

author: pipermerriam
content: Very cool  to have this concept validated.

author: acolytec3
content: If anyone wants to take a look - this very simple react app https://github.com/acolytec3/discv5-browser and this proxy https://github.com/acolytec3/ultralight-proxy make it work

author: acolytec3
content: start the proxy and then the react app.  The discv5 client is available in the browser console with `discv5.addEnr(...` or `discv5.findNode(...`
